alert.note: Alert for Surry (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 23 at 11:11PM EDT by NWS Blacksburg
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Surry, south central Carroll and southwestern Patrick Counties through 1145 PM EDT... At 1110 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Bottom, moving northeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Mount Airy... Elkin... Flat Rock... Dobson... Ararat... Cana... and Mountain Park. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Locally heavy rain will quickly reduce visibility and result in ponding of water on roadways, standing water in low lying areas, and minor flooding of creeks, streams, and areas of poor drainage. Drivers are urged to slow down and use extra caution to avoid hydroplaning. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until midnight EDT for north central and northwestern North Carolina...and south central, southwestern and west central Virginia.
